_header: Alas for thought and inward pain
_description: Supplicacio Amantis, following Lydgate’s Temple of Glass in two manuscripts — 628 lines in couplets

CULGg427.First Lines:
Allas for thought & inward pyneThat myn herte so
                    constreyne…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…with oute smoke of doubilnesseChaung or
                    newfongylnesse…
CULGg427.Note:
Lines 1-254, 331-562 only, incomplete because f. 513 missing and ends
                    imperfectly due to missing f. 517.

BLAdd16165.First Lines:
Ellas for thought and inwarde peyneþat myn hert so
                    constreyne…
BLAdd16165.Last Lines:
…þis al and some my lady dereAnd I youre man frome yere
                    to yere
BLAdd16165.Note:
Follows on from 1403 without a
                    break. Lacks lines 157-76.
BLAdd16165.Attributed Author: made by þe Munke of Bury
BLAdd16165.Attributed Title:
þe dreme of a lover made by þe Munke of Bury (RT); Here
                    endiþe þe dreme and þe complyynte of þe desyrous seruant in
                    loue (f. 241v)

BLSl1212.First Lines:
Ioie helthe ande euery delleThat in short tyme but I
                    fele…
BLSl1212.Last Lines:
…Mi dole and my consolaciounMi laughinge and my wepyng
                    eke…
BLSl1212.Note:
Lines 439-505 only; bottom margin of f. 4, ‘humblement
                        magre’; lower margin f. 4v four lines of Latin,
                    signature of ‘Lucas’ and another Bull’s head drawing with
                    scroll, ‘Mercy made’.
BLSl1212.Editions:
Schick,  Josef,
                        ed.  
             Lydgate’s Temple of Glas.
EETS
         e.s. 60 (1891); repr. 1987: 59-67 (composite text).
